{"step_by_step_thinking": "Peau d'orange is a term used to describe skin that looks like the skin of an orange, which is a common symptom in inflammatory breast cancer. According to Document [0], tumor cells were present in the lymphatic vessels in areas of peau d'orange in 38% of the specimens studied. Document [1] also states that peau d'orange can be caused by cutaneous lymphatic edema, which causes swelling. This suggests that peau d'orange in breast cancer is due to obstruction of sub-dermal lymphatics.", "answer_choice": "A"}
